dublin_core.dcvalue: Continuous passive motion CPM and continuous active motion CAM physiotherapy devices are commonly used to promote rehabilitation of damaged synovial joints A CPM CAM device with no resistive CAM type components is presented In the CPM mode the electric motor functions conventionally but in the CAM mode intelligent use of the motor simulates resistive components by driving the motor to exert a force opposing the patient s muscle activity so as to simulate the effect of a spring load The system easily connects to the Internet or other data links for automatic monitoring of home patients hospital networks research stations or telemedicine applications
Implementation of CAM physiotherapy device with a virtual spring.
